explanation: The correct volume calculation requires multiplying the area of the triangular base (½×base×height) by the prism's depth. The student incorrectly selected the rectangular face formed by the hypotenuse and depth. They likely multiplied hypotenuse length × depth (slanted rectangle area) instead of using the triangle's area. This indicates they conflated the cross-section (triangle) with lateral faces (rectangles) in the prism volume formula. The error aligns with treating a non-cross-section face as the base area, distinct from related height/base misconceptions. The student's reasoning mistakenly associates volume with a composite rectangular face rather than isolating the triangular cross-section.
